reviews.review_msg: fair exams, explains concept well enough to understand the basics.
Majid makes difficult concepts easy to understand and often encourages students to ask questions which shows  his kindness. Show up to all lectures or you'll quickly fall behind.

Invites and answers questions, essential in a challenging course. Lectures can be boring but interesting with good understanding. Exams are fair with no tricks. The extra 10% project is appreciated. Labs are time-consuming; complete 60%-80% before class to finish on time. Practice A LOT, review assignments heavily. No part marks on exams.

one of the best prof I've ever had. He is very willing to help during and outside of class. The course itself was hard enough, but he made it easy to understand by bringing real-life examples during the lectures.

Easily made my top 5 professor list. Despite the course difficulty, he made it very easy for me to understand. So much so that even his slides were enough for me when I started skipping class. His grading scheme was tough but tests were always fair. My only critique is that the labs felt very disorganized/not a major part of the course material.

Pros: Very caring, helpful and accessible outside of class. 2nd quiz was hard but exams were very fair overall. Hard class so he usually scales 2 letter grades.
Neutral: Labs were disorganized but that was more of the TA's responsibility then his.
Cons: Lectures sometimes get boring, but he's infinitely better then other ENSC profs
Majid is a very caring and knowledgeable prof in engineering Science. Excellent lectures.

Majid is s by far one of the best and most caring professors I have had. He is very helpful outside of the class even not on his office hours he is always ready to be helpful. He is very knowledgeable and relates the course materials with practical examples.
He definitely got better as a professor, but his TA is an absolute joke.

Before I had Majid as my professor, I was told by every person who has taken a class with him to avoid him at all costs, but I refused to believe what my peers said. After spending half a semester with Majid, I understand what they meant and WILL NEVER be taking a class with him again.

Lectures were pretty much copy and pasted from the textbook. He would also call out students during lecture, often arguing with them. Overall, he came off kind of rude but was reasonable in his grading. The labs were a mess, sometimes we would go into a lab expected to do things we hadn't learned. Often times a fraction of groups finished on time.
Well, he's a good lecturer and is obviously very knowledgeable in the course material. I found him more approachable than the other two instructors I had this term.
